result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Herring advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Dominic Busalacchi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Colleen M. Riordan in court, in custody, with attorney David L Herring.   

Matter is dismissed and read into case:  15CM1089
Bail Money Moved To Case 15CM1089

Court increases cash bail to:  $200
CONDITIONS:
DEFENDANT HAS ALREADY POSTED $100 CASH AND NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $100 CASH IN ORDER TO BE RELEASED.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  
Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  
Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 18, 2017 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jim Fitzgerald appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Colleen M. Riordan in court with attorney David L Herring.   
Cases:  15CM1089, 15CM2291, 15CM2419 & 16CT418 all called together.
Court to Address - Non-Compliance with WCS.

Defense is waiting on a consolidated offer from the State.
Atty. Herring presented statements to the court regarding the WCS non-compliance.
Any further non-compliance with WCS will result in a warrant being issued, bail being forfeited and the defendant remaining in custody pending resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's non-compliance.
